intro: Acetosella virgosa, commonly known as lesser sorrel, is a low-growing perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves with reddish veins. The plant produces small, pinkish to white flowers in early spring, which are clustered in racemes. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Acetosella virgosa is often found in acidic soils and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
